result.value: Please cite our paper in [JCIM](https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jcim.9b00281) when using PyRod for your research.
PyRod - Tracing water molecules in molecular dynamics simulations

PyRod is a python software developed to generate dynamic molecular interaction fields (dMIFs) and pharmacophore features based on analyzing the protein environment of water molecules in molecular dynamcis simulations.
Check the  for more information on installation and usage. The employed algorithms are described in the PyRod publication in .

Open a new terminal and clone this repository
```bash
git clone https://github.com/schallerdavid/pyrod.git ~/pyrod
```

PyRod is written in python 3.8 and uses MDAnalysis (>= 0.19.0, is shipped with NumPy and SciPy), NumPy and SciPy which can be easily installed using pip:
```bash
pip3 install --upgrade MDAnalysis
```
or 
```bash
python3 -m pip install --upgrade MDAnalysis
```
You can also use conda to install all dependencies:
```bash
conda create -n pyrod -c conda-forge mdanalysis python=3.8
```

result.description: This release fixes two errors that can show up in certain cases in feature and library generation. Also, more alternative residues are supported for ARG, ASP, GLU and Lys. Python 3.8 is now suggested as default, since this improves behaviour of multiprocessing for trajectories with a lot of frames.
result.name: PyRod v0.7.5

result.description: This release fixes an error introduced in PyRod v.0.7.3. This version used to generate double donor and double acceptor features with extremely long hydrogen bonds. Additionally, several options were removed from config files which were irrelevant and confusing for most users.
result.name: PyRod v0.7.4

result.description:
Major clean up of PyRod with improved functionalities.
  - more modular and extendable
  - support of pdb-like pharmacophore format with directionality in all PyRod components
  - improved centroid generation
result.name: PyRod v0.7.3

result.description: Added centroid feature allowing to screen protein conformations with a pharmacophore.
result.name: PyRod v0.7.2

result.description: Major makeover including new topology handling and dmif excess.
result.name: PyRod v0.7.1

result.description: Novel config file system makes PyRod easier to handle.
result.name: PyRod v0.7.0

result.description: Added t stacking functionality. Faster dmif calculation by using math module instead of numpy for several functions.
result.name: PyRod v0.6.3

result.description: Added distance dependency for aromatic interactions and logging functionality.
result.name: PyRod v0.6.2

result.value:
PyRod is written in python 3.8 and uses MDAnalysis (>= 0.19.0, is shipped with NumPy and SciPy), NumPy and SciPy which can be easily installed using pip:
```bash
pip3 install --upgrade MDAnalysis
```
or 
```bash
python3 -m pip install --upgrade MDAnalysis
```
You can also use conda to install all dependencies:
```bash
conda create -n pyrod -c conda-forge mdanalysis python=3.8
```
An example Jupyter Notebook for visualization of dMIFs using NGLView is provided in the [example directory](https://github.com/schallerdavid/pyrod/tree/master/example).
